metadata.titleEn: Physical and chemical characteristics data set of atmospheric dust in Yadong, Qinghai Tibet Plateau (2021)
metadata.description: The data set includes basic temperature, humidity and pressure wind meteorological elements, black carbon concentration, scattering coefficient, particle size spectrum data and chemical composition analysis. Automatic weather station can measure temperature, relative humidity, air pressure, wind direction, wind speed and accumulated precipitation. AE-33 black carbon meter (hereinafter referred to as AE-33) can online measure the concentration of black carbon aerosol in the 370nm, 470nm, 520nm, 590nm, 660nm, 880nm and 950nm bands of TSP (total suspended particulate matter) in the atmosphere, and the mass absorption cross sections used are 18.47, 14.54, 13.14, 11.58, 10.35, 7.77 and 7.19 m2/g respectively. The official observation period is from June 12, 2021 to August 31, 2021, with a time resolution of 1 minute. The table data has been processed subsequently and is hourly data. The Integrated Nephelometer can measure the scattering coefficient of PM2.5 in the atmosphere at 450nm, 550nm and 700nm on line. The official observation period is from June 12, 2021 to August 31, 2021, with a time resolution of 10 seconds. The table data has been processed subsequently and is hourly data. Aerodynamic Particle Size Spectrometer (hereinafter referred to as APS) can measure 0.5-20 in the atmosphere online Î¼ The number concentration particle size distribution spectrum of particles within m (aerodynamic diameter) particle size range has 50 particle size channels. The official observation period is from June 12, 2021 to August 31, 2021, with a time resolution of 5 minutes. The table data has been processed subsequently and is hourly data. The scanning electromobility particle size spectrometer (SMPS) can measure the particle size distribution of 13.6-514 nm (Stokes diameter) in the atmosphere online; TSI 3752 Condensed Nucleus Particle Counter (CPC) is used to measure the number and concentration of particles. The official observation period is from June 29, 2021 to August 31, 2021, with a time resolution of 5 minutes. The table data has been processed subsequently and is hourly data. The domestic medium flow sampler was used to collect the 90mm diameter quartz filter membrane, water soaked quartz filter membrane and Teflon filter membrane of TSP particle size section. The samples can be used for the analysis of chemical components such as elemental carbon, organic carbon, water-soluble ions and metal elements. The sampling period is from June 23, 2021 to August 29, 2021. The sampling starts at 11:00 a.m. and takes 71 hours each time.
metadata.instructions:
File Naming: All data is stored in one Excel worksheet. The Excel file name is YD dataset. The different worksheets are named Instructions, WXT, AE-33, NEPH, APS, SMPS and Air samples.
Data Reading Method: All data files in the dataset can be opened directly in Excel.

literatureList.titleEn: Unexpected high absorption of atmospheric aerosols over a western Tibetan Plateau site in summer

Journal of Geophysical Research: Atmospheres, 126, e2020JD033286. https://doi.org/10.1029/2020JD033286

Example.Question: Can you provide an example of a data collection method used for measuring atmospheric black carbon aerosol concentrations in multiple spectral bands?
Example.Answer: An example of a data collection method is using the AE-33 Aethalometer, which measures atmospheric black carbon aerosol concentrations in multiple spectral bands (370nm, 470nm, 520nm, 590nm, 660nm, 880nm, and 950nm). The instrument operates with a mass absorption cross-section of 18.47, 14.54, 13.14, 11.58, 10.35, 7.77, and 7.19 m2/g respectively, with a formal observation period from June 12, 2021, to August 31, 2021, at a time resolution of 1 minute, processed into hourly data.

Feature Specification.Question: What are the characteristics and properties of atmospheric dust datasets collected in high-altitude regions like the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau?
Feature Specification.Answer: temperature, relative humidity, pressure, wind direction, wind speed, precipitation, black carbon concentration, scattering coefficients for PM2.5, particle size distribution, elemental carbon, organic carbon, water-soluble ions, metallic elements

Causal Antecedent.Question: What factors might contribute to challenges in accurately measuring atmospheric black carbon concentrations across different spectral bands in the region?
Causal Antecedent.Answer: The measurement of atmospheric black carbon concentrations across different spectral bands might be challenged by factors such as the precision of the AE-33 black carbon instrument, which uses specific mass absorption cross-sections for each band, ranging from 7.19 to 18.47 m2/g. Variability in atmospheric conditions, such as temperature, pressure, and humidity, which are measured by the automatic weather station, could also affect the accuracy of these measurements.

Goal Orientation.Question: What are the primary objectives of collecting data on the physicochemical characteristics of atmospheric dust in the Tibetan Plateau region, and how can this data inform broader environmental research?
Goal Orientation.Answer: The primary objectives of collecting data on the physicochemical characteristics of atmospheric dust in the Tibetan Plateau region include understanding the local climate conditions, assessing air quality, and analyzing the chemical composition of atmospheric particles. This data provides insights into the atmospheric processes and environmental changes in the region, which can inform broader environmental research by contributing to climate models, pollution studies, and assessments of the impact of atmospheric particles on health and ecosystems.

Instrumental/Procedural.Question: What procedural steps are involved in collecting and processing atmospheric dust data, including meteorological factors, black carbon concentration, scattering coefficients, and particle size distributions, in high-altitude regions like the Tibetan Plateau?
Instrumental/Procedural.Answer: The procedural steps involve using an automated meteorological station to measure meteorological elements such as temperature, relative humidity, pressure, wind direction, wind speed, and cumulative precipitation. An AE-33 Aethalometer measures atmospheric black carbon aerosol concentration at multiple wavelengths. An Integrating Nephelometer measures PM2.5 scattering coefficients at specific wavelengths. An Aerodynamic Particle Sizer Spectrometer measures particle size distributions within a specified aerodynamic diameter range, and a Scanning Mobility Particle Sizer Spectrometer, coupled with a Condensation Particle Counter, measures particle size distribution in a different range. Data is collected during specified observation periods with varying time resolutions and is subsequently processed into hourly data. Additionally, medium-flow samplers collect TSP samples on different filter types for chemical composition analysis, including elemental carbon, organic carbon, water-soluble ions, and metal elements, with a specific sampling schedule.

Enablement.Question: What technological advancements enable the accurate measurement and analysis of black carbon concentrations at multiple wavelengths in atmospheric dust studies?
Enablement.Answer: The use of the AE-33 Aethalometer allows for online measurement of black carbon aerosol concentrations in TSP at wavelengths of 370nm, 470nm, 520nm, 590nm, 660nm, 880nm, and 950nm, using specific mass absorption cross-sections for each wavelength.
